title: Hebrew classic font
content:
I’m looking for a Hebrew typeface to compliment Trajan Pro. I’ve found several typefaces which include Hebrew letters in their glyphs and have research a few classic typefaces to see if they offer Hebrew letters. Can anyone recommend a classic Hebrew typeface and where to buy it? Thank you.

 [‹ Lefty's Hideout typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706110719/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45178 "Go to previous forum topic") [Double Whammy Type ID ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706110719/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45084 "Go to next forum topic")
author: csmitchy

comments.content:
[From Typophiler David Hamuel.](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706110719/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/lighthouse/)

[Masterfont](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706110719/http:/www.masterfont.co.il/), the biggest Israeli distributer, also available through [Myfonts.](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706110719/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/masterfont/)

[Fontbit](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706110719/http:/fontbit.co.il/) is another foundry recommended by an Israeli compositor here.

There are also individual designers...

Matching Hebrew and latin script is always a problem because of the reverse weighting: Latin has as a rule thick verticals, thin horizontals. Hebrew is the reverse.

So your design will be as important as choice of typeface.
